abstract: Military denies request from family of deceased pilot Elaine D Harmon, who served with Women Airforce Service Pilots in World War II, to inter her ashes at Arlington National Cemetery; claim her wartime unit was not technically part of military; Arizona Rep Martha McSally introduces House bill that would grant WASPs burial rights in Arlington.

headline.print_headline: World War II Pilots, Barred From Arlington
headline.main: Female Pilot Unit Gains Support in Congress for Right to Arlington Burials

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

snippet: A lack of active-duty status keeps World War II veterans of the Women Airforce Service Pilots, known as the WASPs, out of the cemetery, but a House bill would change that.
lead_paragraph: A lack of active-duty status keeps World War II veterans of the Women Airforce Service Pilots, known as the WASPs, out of the cemetery, but a House bill would change that.
